body_html:
@bignamehyp
I was able to resolve my issue! It was actually because I lacked the "checkpoint" text file of the format

model_checkpoint_path: "baseline-ckpt"
all_model_checkpoint_paths: "baseline-ckpt"

in checkpoint_dir.

The local variable 'metrics' referenced before assignment error is probably just failing to catch that case when no checkpoints can be found.

Could you also add from tensorflow.python.platform import tf_logging as logging to eval_util.py in the place of import logging, as it is really hard to tell what's going on without the logging messages.

body:
@bignamehyp 
I was able to resolve my issue! It was actually because I lacked the "checkpoint" text file of the format
> model_checkpoint_path: "baseline-ckpt"
> all_model_checkpoint_paths: "baseline-ckpt"

in `checkpoint_dir`.

The `local variable 'metrics' referenced before assignment` error is probably just failing to catch that case when no checkpoints can be found. 

Could you also add `from tensorflow.python.platform import tf_logging as logging` to `eval_util.py` in the place of `import logging`, as it is really hard to tell what's going on without the logging messages.
